comments.body: Does this have to be in main.go?

It definitely could be put somewhere else. I was thinking to have all necessary code in main and cloud providers only have to pay attention to main.go. They definitely could rearrange the code. Would you think it would be better to have a separate file for those kind of func?

Guessing this would be less objectionable if we were more explicit that this is an "example"/compile check for the extension mechanisms. Clearly should not be in our sample, so we should use every opportunity to point viewers to the basic sample code.
Thanks for review. Added an README.md and separated the controller func from main.go.

So its not just in-tree providers. Out of tree providers can do the same things, however the import would obviously be to where ever they have their cloud provider implementation. For example Huawei has their implementation in https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/cloud-provider-huaweicloud/tree/master/pkg/cloudprovider/huaweicloud.
